CatDescriptText: Miss Stephanie Palczynski, office worker, Sharpsburg, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 3, 1962, pg. 10 with question: "In what way do you think the successful orbiting of Col. John Glenn will aid the United States in its relationship with other countries?"  Answer reads: " The only thinking I can say is that we can't tell.  When man succeeded in making the first airplane flight, everyone wondered what would come of it.  The same thinking goes here.  Who knows what will happen?"
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Stephanie Palczynski wearing overcoat with brooch on rounded collar, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Toki Schalk Johnson wearing dark suit, seated at desk holding plaque in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper office
